findings.description: The contract accepts ETH in buy() but never transfers that ETH to anyone and provides no withdrawal function. As a result, any ETH sent to buy() becomes permanently locked in the contract.
findings.location_claimed: buy() / contract design (no ETH withdrawal or forwarding)
findings.reasoning: This finding meets all the strict criteria for BONUS_VALID: 1) There is a concrete exploit where ETH is permanently locked; 2) No trusted role compromise is required; 3) There is no existing mitigation; 4) The issue is in scope; 5) It is not a design choice; 6) There is a material impact of loss of user funds.

findings.description: buy() calls token.transferFrom(...) but does not check the returned boolean. For ERC20 tokens that signal failure by returning false (instead of reverting), the call can fail silently and the function will still proceed to update critical state (price and owner).
findings.location_claimed: buy(): token.transferFrom(msg.sender, owner, price); (return value not checked)
findings.reasoning: This finding meets all the strict criteria for BONUS_VALID: 1) There is a concrete exploit where ownership can be taken without transferring tokens; 2) No trusted role compromise is required; 3) There is no existing mitigation; 4) The issue is in scope; 5) It is not a design choice; 6) There is a material impact of unauthorized access to protected functions and loss of user funds.

target_assessment.type_match_reasoning: The target vulnerability (front_running) was not mentioned in the analysis.

notes: The analysis did not identify the target vulnerability (front_running) but did find two other valid vulnerabilities related to locked funds and unchecked return values.
